key_facts: Global plastic pollution treaty negotiations have collapsed.
Over 200 countries met in South Korea to finalize the treaty.
Disagreements arose between high-ambition and oil-producing countries.
Saudi Arabia and Kuwait opposed plastic production cuts.
Oil-rich nations cited economic impacts and development rights.
A coalition of 95 countries pushed for legally binding plastic output reductions.
The coalition warned of growing environmental damage from plastic.
The coalition cited increasing public pressure for action.
Environmental groups criticized fossil fuel industry influence.
The treaty collapse is seen as a missed opportunity for global coordination.
Pro-regulation countries are being urged to create their own treaty.
